alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 26 at 9:28AM PST until December 30 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet and local sets to 20 feet with life-threatening rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Warning, significant coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 15 to 20 feet and local sets to 25 feet with life-threatening rip currents. The most dangerous conditions are expected on Thursday. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 4 AM PST Thursday. For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to 10 PM PST Saturday. For the High Surf Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Significant flooding of sea water is likely over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas around the time of high tide. Damage to coastal roadways and structures is possible. Powerful waves and strong rip currents will pose an exceptional risk of ocean drowning and damage to coastal structures like piers and jetties. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Each morning Thursday through Saturday, residual high tides of 5.7 to 6.3 feet will enhance the coastal flooding risk.
info.instruction: Stay off of beaches and coastal walkways, roads, and structures. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other water side infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
